availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis M. Oakley (Bath County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer. Bath County, Kentucky, native. Son of George Oakley and Mary Oakley. Married to Martha Oakley. Father of Edgar Oakley. Resident of Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1861. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal and sergeant from December 31, 1861, to July 9, 1862. Discharged on account of disability on July 9, 1862. Farmer in Bath County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 13B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville Precinct, p. 55A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0370.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Bath County, KY, October 1863, p. 276.
"Francis M Oakley (1840-1924)," Find A Grave, Memorial 57021065, accessed February 16, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57021065.
